info.title: Keycloak Admin REST API
info.description: This is a REST API reference for the Keycloak Admin REST API.

get.summary: Get accessible realms Returns a list of accessible realms. The list is filtered based on what realms the caller is allowed to view.

post.summary: Import a realm. Imports a realm from a full representation of that realm.

get.summary: Get the top-level representation of the realm It will not include nested information like User and Client representations.

put.summary: Update the top-level information of the realm Any user, roles or client information in the representation will be ignored.
put.description: This will only update top-level attributes of the realm.

get.summary: Get admin events Returns all admin events, or filters events based on URL query parameters listed here

delete.summary: Clear any user login failures for all users This can release temporary disabled users

get.summary: Get status of a username in brute force detection

delete.summary: Clear any user login failures for the user This can release temporary disabled user

get.description: The method is really to show a comprehensive total view of realm-level roles associated with the client.

parameters.description: if false, return roles with their attributes

get.summary: Get client session stats Returns a JSON map.
get.description: The key is the client id, the value is the number of sessions that currently are active with that client. Only clients that actually have a session associated with them will be in this map.

get.summary: Get clients belonging to the realm.
get.description: If a client canâ€™t be retrieved from the storage due to a problem with the underlying storage, it is silently removed from the returned list. This ensures that concurrent modifications to the list donâ€™t prevent callers from retrieving this list.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: whether this is a search query or a getClientById query

parameters.name: viewableOnly
parameters.description: filter clients that cannot be viewed in full by admin

Only generated public certificate is saved in Keycloak DB - the private key is not.

Return list of all protocol mappers, which will be used when generating tokens issued for particular client.
get.description: This means protocol mappers assigned to this client directly and protocol mappers assigned to all client scopes of this client.

get.summary: Get effective scope mapping of all roles of particular role container, which this client is defacto allowed to have in the accessToken issued for him.
get.description: This contains scope mappings, which this client has directly, as well as scope mappings, which are granted to all client scopes, which are linked with this client.

parameters.name: roleContainerId
parameters.description: either realm name OR client UUID

get.summary: Get roles, which this client doesn't have scope for and can't have them in the accessToken issued for him.
get.description: Defacto all the other roles of particular role container, which are not in {@link #getGrantedScopeMappings()}

parameters.name: roleContainerId
parameters.description: either realm name OR client UUID

get.summary: Get users Returns a stream of users, filtered according to query parameters

parameters.name: briefRepresentation
parameters.description: Only return basic information (only guaranteed to return id, username, created, first and last name, email, enabled state, email verification state, federation link, and access. Note that it means that namely user attributes, required actions, and not before are not returned.)

post.summary: Test SMTP connection with current logged in user

get.summary: Get users Returns a stream of users, filtered according to query parameters.

parameters.name: briefRepresentation
parameters.description: Boolean which defines whether brief representations are returned (default: false)

parameters.name: email
parameters.description: A String contained in email, or the complete email, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: emailVerified
parameters.description: whether the email has been verified

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Boolean representing if user is enabled or not

parameters.name: exact
parameters.description: Boolean which defines whether the params "last", "first", "email" and "username" must match exactly

parameters.name: firstName
parameters.description: A String contained in firstName, or the complete firstName, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: idpAlias
parameters.description: The alias of an Identity Provider linked to the user

parameters.name: idpUserId
parameters.description: The userId at an Identity Provider linked to the user

parameters.name: lastName
parameters.description: A String contained in lastName, or the complete lastName, if param "exact" is true

parameters.name: q
parameters.description: A query to search for custom attributes, in the format 'key1:value2 key2:value2'

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: A String contained in username, first or last name, or email. Default search behavior is prefix-based (e.g., foo or foo*). Use *foo* for infix search and "foo" for exact search.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: A String contained in username, or the complete username, if param "exact" is true

post.summary: Create a new user Username must be unique.

get.summary: Returns the number of users that match the given criteria.
get.description:
It can be called in three different ways. 1. Donâ€™t specify any criteria and pass {@code null}. The number of all users within that realm will be returned.

2. If {@code search} is specified other criteria such as {@code last} will be ignored even though you set them. The {@code search} string will be matched against the first and last name, the username and the email of a user.

3. If {@code search} is unspecified but any of {@code last}, {@code first}, {@code email} or {@code username} those criteria are matched against their respective fields on a user entity. Combined with a logical and.

parameters.name: enabled
parameters.description: Boolean representing if user is enabled or not

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: arbitrary search string for all the fields below. Default search behavior is prefix-based (e.g., foo or foo*). Use *foo* for infix search and "foo" for exact search.

get.description: Get the configuration for the user profile

put.description: Set the configuration for the user profile

get.description: Get the UserProfileMetadata from the configuration

parameters.name: userProfileMetadata
parameters.description: Indicates if the user profile metadata should be added to the response

get.summary: Return credential types, which are provided by the user storage where user is stored.
get.description: Returned values can contain for example "password", "otp" etc. This will always return empty list for "local" users, which are not backed by any user storage

get.summary: Get consents granted by the user

delete.summary: Revoke consent and offline tokens for particular client from user
Remove a credential for a user

post.summary: Move a credential to a position behind another credential

parameters.name: newPreviousCredentialId
parameters.description: The credential that will be the previous element in the list. If set to null, the moved credential will be the first element in the list.

post.summary: Move a credential to a first position in the credentials list of the user

put.summary: Update a credential label for a user
Disable all credentials for a user of a specific type
Send an email to the user with a link they can click to execute particular actions.
put.description: An email contains a link the user can click to perform a set of required actions. The redirectUri and clientId parameters are optional. If no redirect is given, then there will be no link back to click after actions have completed. Redirect uri must be a valid uri for the particular clientId.

parameters.name: lifespan
parameters.description: Number of seconds after which the generated token expires

post.summary: Add a social login provider to the user

delete.summary: Remove a social login provider from user

post.summary: Impersonate the user
Remove all user sessions associated with the user Also send notification to all clients that have an admin URL to invalidate the sessions for the particular user.

get.summary: Get offline sessions associated with the user and client

put.summary: Set up a new password for the user.
Send an email to the user with a link they can click to reset their password.
put.description: The redirectUri and clientId parameters are optional. The default for the redirect is the account client. This endpoint has been deprecated.  Please use the execute-actions-email passing a list with UPDATE_PASSWORD within it.

put.summary: Send an email-verification email to the user An email contains a link the user can click to verify their email address.
put.description: The redirectUri, clientId and lifespan parameters are optional. The default for the redirect is the account client. The default for the lifespan is 12 hours

parameters.name: lifespan
parameters.description: Number of seconds after which the generated token expires

get.summary: Get sessions associated with the user
